This module has helper used to clean blocks Blocks may have Newline Values, so when you want to actually use its contents, we make sure that there will be none

Imports

types

Procs

func cleanedBlockImpl(va: ValueArray): ValueArray {.inline, enforceNoRaises,
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Iterators

iterator cleanedBlockValues(v: Value; L: int): lent Value {....raises: [], tags: [].}

yield a Value object per iteration, while ignoring all Newline values

Note:

  • This is to be used inside a for loop.

Usage:

for i in cleanedBlockValues(y, y.a.len):
    x.a[cnt] = i
    inc cnt

Macros

macro ensureCleaned(name: untyped): untyped

Templates

template cleanBlock(v: Value)

remove all Newline values from a Block value, in-place

Hint: v must be a Value, not a ValueArray ( This is an optimization, as Block values have a .dirty attribute: if .dirty is false it'll do nothing.). When done, .dirty'll be set to false.

template cleanedBlock(va: ValueArray; inplace = false): untyped
template cleanedBlockValues(v: Value): untyped

yield a Value object per iteration, while ignoring all Newline values

Note:

  • Detects v.a's length automatically
  • This is to be used inside a for loop.

Usage:

for i in cleanedBlockValues(y):
     x.a[cnt] = i
     inc cnt


template cleanedBlockValuesCopy(v: Value): untyped
